actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Mr. Solarz moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Leach (IA) demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
Yeas and Nays were ordered. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 413 - 0 (Roll no. 8).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: Expressing the sense of Congress concerning negotiations for a political settlement in Cambodia.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the proposals of the Coalition Government of Democratic Kampuchea for a quadripartite interim government and of the People's Republic of Kampuchea for remaining in power are not acceptable bases for negotiations. Endorses the proposal for an enhanced United Nations (UN) role in Cambodia, including a UN-supervised interim administration and an international peacekeeping force. Urges the President to continue to pursue an international consensus regarding such proposal. Declares that: (1) the support of the Governments of the Soviet Union, China, and Vietnam for the concept of a UN-supervised interim administration and their active cooperation in facilitating an agreement will contribute to improved relations between such countries and the United States; and (2) the establishment of such an interim administration would reflect a new spirit of cooperation and serve as a model for future Security Council peacekeeping efforts.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress concerning negotiations for a political settlement in Cambodia.
